com.tomzhu.tree

Class BasicTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomzhu.tree.BasicTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of element.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tree

    public class BasicTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tree
    a basic tree implementation. for a basic tree , each tree node may has different number of children,
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    tomzhu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicTree()
      create an empty tree.
      BasicTree(E root)
      construct a basic tree using element root

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> neededNode)
      add the neededNode to the node as it's children.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> neededNode, int location)
      add the neededNode to the node as it's children at specific location, then return the added node namely neededNode.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, E value)
      add a child node to the specific node and return the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, E value, int location)
      add a child node to parameter node at specific location, throw MyNotSupportException when the location is not reliable.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChildren(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E>[] neededNodes)
      add the neededNodes to the node from left to right.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addChildren(BasicTreeNode<E> node, E[] values)
      create neededNodes using values and add them to the node from left to right.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addLeftSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> neededNode)
      add left sibling node(neededNode) to the specific node and return the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addLeftSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node, E value)
      add left sibling node using value to the specific node and return the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> addRightSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node, E value)
      add right sibling node to the specific node and return the added node.
      BasicTreeNode<E> clearChildren(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      clear the node's children and return the node.
      boolean containChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> child) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, int i)
      return the child node at specific location i for the node.
      int getChildrenSize(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E>[] getChilds(BasicTreeNode<E> node, boolean leftToRight)
      return children as an array, leftToRight imply the order.
      BasicTreeNode<E> getFirstChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getLastChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getLeftSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getParent(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getRightSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> getRoot() 
      boolean hasChildren(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      boolean hasLeftSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      boolean hasRightSibling(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      boolean isEmpty() 
      boolean isFirstChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      boolean isLastChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      boolean isRoot(BasicTreeNode<E> node) 
      BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> removedNode)
      remove the removedNode as node's children and return the removedNode.
      BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, int i)
      remove the i-th child of the node and return the removed child.
      BasicTreeNode<E> removeFirstChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      remove the node's first child node and return it, throw MyNosuchElementException when the node has no children.
      BasicTreeNode<E> removeLastChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node)
      remove the node's last child node and return it, throw MyNosuchElementException when the node has no children.
      int searchChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node, BasicTreeNode<E> child)

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node,
                                    int i)
                             throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the i-th child of the node and return the removed child. throw MyNosuchElementException when the location i is not reliable.
        Parameters:
        node -
        i -
        Returns:
        i-th child of the node.
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException

      • removeChild

        public BasicTreeNode<E> removeChild(BasicTreeNode<E> node,
                                    BasicTreeNode<E> removedNode)
                             throws MyNosuchElementException
        remove the removedNode as node's children and return the removedNode. return null if it is not the child of the node. MyNosuchElementException is not possible to throw. see BasicTreeNode for more understanding.
        Parameters:
        removedNode -
        node -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        MyNosuchElementException
